env.name: envelope
env.description: Executable workflow definitions (scenario documents) identified by env:* ids.

ds.name: data_schema
ds.description: JSON Schema identifiers that define the shape and constraints of data objects.

role.name: role
role.description: Actor roles participating in MOVA workflows (humans, services, systems).

res.name: resource
res.description: External or internal resources used by envelopes (HTTP endpoints, queues, storage, documents, etc.).

st.name: state
st.description: Business states used to track the lifecycle of entities and workflows.

artifact_kinds.summary: JSON Schema documents that define the structure and constraints of data objects.
artifact_kinds.description: Data schemas are authored and versioned independently from envelopes. They are registered in the MOVA global catalog under dataSchemas[] with ids starting with 'ds:' and a schema_uri pointing to the actual JSON Schema file.
artifact_kinds.notes: Typical examples include ds:personal_profile_v1_de and ds:buergergeld_antrag_v1.

artifact_kinds.summary: Executable workflow definitions (plans of steps) that move data through verbs.
artifact_kinds.description: Each envelope describes a scenario via plan.steps[]. Steps may refer to roles, resources, data schemas and states using their ids from the global catalog. At runtime an envelope is combined with a global catalog and an input context.
artifact_kinds.notes: env:* ids are the primary handles for runtimes, schedulers and tools when selecting which scenario to run.

artifact_kinds.summary: Shared registry of roles, resources, data schemas and states used by envelopes.
artifact_kinds.description: The global catalog document itself is not prefix-based, but its entries are: roles use 'role:', resources use 'res:', dataSchemas use 'ds:' and states use 'st:'. Envelopes resolve these ids at execution time.
artifact_kinds.notes: Typically, one global catalog is active per execution environment, providing a consistent set of roles, resources, schemas and states.

artifact_kinds.summary: Concrete JSON documents representing data conforming to a schema or an execution trace of an envelope.
artifact_kinds.description: Instances live in project-level folders. A data instance usually conforms to exactly one ds:* schema. A run instance may record the input context, intermediate step outputs and final result of executing an envelope.
artifact_kinds.notes: Tools may store the claimed schema id and/or envelope id inside instance metadata to support validation and inspection.

artifact_kinds.summary: Minimal packages that bundle schemas, envelopes and example instances for a domain task.
artifact_kinds.description: Template sets organise MOVA artifacts by domain (social, e-commerce, logistics, etc.). A typical set contains one or more ds:* schemas, one or more env:* envelopes and a small number of example instances used for documentation and tests.
artifact_kinds.notes: Template sets are the main unit for publishing and discovery in tools such as MOVA Workbench or a template marketplace.

jsonld.comment: Reserved lane for future JSON-LD @context definitions for schemas and global catalogs.
